instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> blown
threads.message:
hey all.

i have waterdamage macbook air, everything looks good except no backlight upon closer inspection (near lvds connector) i found the probe point for <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> blown.
Does this mean jumper from pin 5 <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> blown
threads.message: It's possible you can run the small wire from near coil to the diode. Best to replace the LED driver regardless to avoid warranty returns.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL> blown
threads.message:
A recent post shows a way to recover that brodge.
If no way to resoldar in the central point, then search Louis channel on YouTube, about how to solder a tiny wire in the other side.
You can also see in the same post which points form other side need to be connected.
